intro: Fimbristylis exilis var. senegalensis, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a grass-like plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded areas, such as marshes and rice fields. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often inconspicuous. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes many other sedge species. Its botanical structure is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
